title: Index
description: An Index is an Observable which is computed based on the prices, rates or valuations of a number of assets that are tracked in a standardized way.  Examples include equity market indices as well as indices on interest rates, inflation and credit instruments.

CreditIndex.description: An index based on credit risk, typically composed using corporate debt instruments in a region or industry sector, e.g. the iTraxx indices.

EquityIndex.description: An index based on equity securities, e.g. the S&P 500.

InterestRateIndex.description: An index based in interest rates or inflation rates in a certain market.

ForeignExchangeRateIndex.description: A rate based on the exchange of a pair of cash assets in specific currencies, e.g. USD versus GBP.

OtherIndex.description: An index created by a market participant which doesn't align with the other index types.
